words.definition: To associate means to connect something with a person or thing.
words.example: Most people associate birthday parties with having fun.

words.definition: The environment is the place where people, animals, and plants live.
words.example: Keep our environment clean by not littering.

words.definition: A factory is a building where things are made or put together.
words.example: This factory produces many cars every day.

words.definition: A feature is an important part of something.
words.example: The cell phone has many cool features.

words.definition: An instance is an example of something.
words.example: I have never seen another instance of such a large bird.

words.definition: To involve means to include as a necessary part.
words.example: The job involves a lot of traveling.

words.definition: Medicine is something you take to feel better or treat an illness.
words.example: The doctor gave me medicine for my cold.

words.definition: To mix is to combine two or more things together.
words.example: The baker mixed the flour and water together.

words.definition: To organize is to plan or arrange something in a systematic way.
words.example: She organized her books by color.

words.definition: A period is an amount of time.
words.example: This period of history was very peaceful.

words.definition: If people populate an area, they live there.
words.example: Millions of people populate this city.

words.definition: To produce is to make or grow something.
words.example: Trees produce oxygen for us to breathe.

words.definition: A range is a number or a set of different things of the same general type.
words.example: I offered her a range of choices from one to ten.

words.definition: To recognize is to know because you have seen it before.
words.example: I recognized an old friend from high school.

words.definition: If something is regular, it happens over and over and at the same time.
words.example: Our regular meeting is on Fridays.

words.definition: A sign is an indication that something is happening or exists.
words.example: The dark clouds are a sign of rain.

words.definition: A tip is a pointed end of something long.
words.example: The tip of the pencil was very sharp.

words.definition: A tradition is a custom or belief that has existed for a long time.
words.example: Eating turkey on Thanksgiving is a tradition.

words.definition: Trash is waste material or things that are no longer wanted.
words.example: Please put your trash in the bin.

words.definition: If something is wide, it is large from side to side.
words.example: The river was very wide.
